Articles.Content:
Sorry if this is nothing to do with this mod at all but I thought I should see if anyone has come across this problem below.

I had this problem once last week and it seemed to have sorted itself out after restarting the game, tried the same 3 times so far and its still showing up as this?

Any help or advice would be much appreciated.

I'm having frame rate issues while in map view when there are maneuver nodes, my fps drops down from 60 to 30-40, and the strange thing is that it doesn't always happen. Is there an optimization fix or something? I have a fairly beast-ish PC so it shouldn't be because of my PC specs.

They do, occur, just fairly rare. Such a long list in the plan, I just want the overhaul branch to work

That's a very rational want.
So what is everyone using these days, 7-4? I remember a while back everyone was trying the overhaul versions but I wasn't having luck.

So what is everyone using these days, 7-4? I remember a while back everyone was trying the overhaul versions but I wasn't having luck.

7-4 is working just fine for me in x86 0.25.

7-4 is working just fine for me in x86 0.25.

Ok, that's what I'm using. Good to know I'm not lost. Like usual.

Sorry if this is nothing to do with this mod at all but I thought I should see if anyone has come across this problem below.

I had this problem once last week and it seemed to have sorted itself out after restarting the game, tried the same 3 times so far and its still showing up as this?

Any help or advice would be much appreciated.

http://i.imgur.com/coBlPEc.jpg

Looks like the Kerbals have gone meta with their colonization...their new civilizations are literally covering the planet.

@AlMacTavish

I have this problem , too.

Edited October 15, 2014 by lextor

@AlMacTavish

I have this problem , too.

Ok, I went through every mod I use one by one last night which is extremely time consuming with Kerbal loading times lol. I didnt get the Kerbin texture issue until I put in hot rockets, downloaded the HotRockets 7.25 Core Pack again and this seems to have sorted the issue.
I'm running 7-4 on x86 0.25 with no crashes, but also no city lights.

I'm running 7-4 on x86 0.25 with no crashes, but also no city lights.

This is my case too. Haven't experienced a CTD as a direct of EVE, and it used to work perfectly until tonight (although I never had the city lights...).

Here's what it looks like now:

From orbit.

Coming in for a splashdown (overshot KSC ), the water started to turn invisible and it looked like low-res city lights underneath.

Halp me pls

go to: GameData\EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements\Plugins

remove: "CityLights.dll"

I had the same issue, but not anymore. The lights work fine for me. No idea how or why.

Hi, i installed the patch a few sites ago some one postet it cant find the post right now.

I never had problems with 0.25 x86 everything works fine also city lights are working and the clouds update error spam is also gone

Im searching the post after work

Going to try this out in 0.25. Is it working with ATM?

Cheers!
Waiting for a patch from the creator of this mod. I look forward to returning my city lights.
I am using this, Better Atmospheres and ATM with 0.25 without any problems. everything seems working just fine.

Thanks, will install it right now

Cheers!
Nice mod, have some Rep! Hope you can update soon, as this is on my list to get Soon!TM

Halp me pls

This is odd because this just started happening to me as well, and it didn't previously. I tried re-installing EVE and it worked, not sure if it was that or restarting KSP, but almost immediately (within five minutes) started doing this again. Odd I could get twenty or so hours until it happens and now it does. I'm wondering if it isn't a conflict somewhere else, but I can't think of any mod changes I made except possibly updates which would be much harder to isolate.
Where are the low and medium resolution textures?

I have just rediscovered my city lights, and while I think mine were missing for a reason that more experienced people would have spotted, I'll repeat it here for the rest of us.

It turns out the ambient light dimming in planetshine was just blocking them out. commenting out that line of planetshine's config now has me the best of both worlds - the gentle illumination from the dayside, and my cities back once again on the night side

Anyone using EVE 7-4, 9-2 or post-9-2 in 0.25 with KSOS?

Whenever I load a savegame and jump into KSOS, I lose the cloud and city layer on the currently visible side of Kerbin. City and lights return when crossing the terminator, but crossing it again into daylight only yields clouds over land. I also get significant slowdowns once in a while.

This doesn't happen with other currently active ships (tested with stock and HGR) and switching to one of these other ships and back to KSOS is the only way to get the entire cloud layer back.

I'm not sure whether this is due to one of KSOS' modules conflicting with EVE, KSOS' huge texture load or simply because of a broken savegame.

- Edit:

It's not the savegame. Started another sandbox game, launched KSOS to orbit, quit, loaded and the problem recurred.

- EditÃ‚Â²:

7-4 loads correctly, but displays the night side shading bug.

- EditÃ‚Â³:

The latest EVE Overhaul build from GIT exhibits the same behaviour as the 9.2 one. Plus abyssimal framerates.

- Edit4:

7-4 works perfectly, as long as PlanetShine isn't installed.

Edited October 18, 2014 by Ph34rb0t
Damn... I wanted to use both of these mods... Guess I'll have to make a choice.

7-4 works perfectly, as long as PlanetShine isn't installed.

Really? Because it's working perfectly for me on 32-bit.

Really? Because it's working perfectly for me on 32-bit.

Planetshine 2.1?

Note: I'm talking about EVE, PlanetShine and KSOS. I didn't have any problem with other ships, EVE 9-2 and PlanetShine.
